text: Soon after the discovery of programmed ribosomal frameshifting, it was proposed that frameshifting may be a common mechanism for dual decoding of genetic information (Dinman, 2012a) . The existence of an alternative genome has been postulated, but it has remained difficult to identify. Most methods aim to identify frameshifting events, but very few can determine which produce functional out-of-frame gene products.
